Getting started

Learn how to set up StrataKit in your project.

This guide is aimed towards developers.

Foundations

Section titled “Foundations”

To use StrataKit in a React project, you will first need to ensure that the @stratakit/foundations package has been installed and set up correctly. This package is the heart of the design system and is expected to be set up by the host application.

To set up this package, see the detailed instructions in @stratakit/foundations/README.md. If you’re using iTwinUI, you will also need to configure the theme bridge.

Icons

Section titled “Icons”

All StrataKit icons are available as standalone .svg files in the @stratakit/icons package. This package also requires additional bundler configuration that is described in @stratakit/icons/README.md.

See full list of available icons.

Components

Section titled “Components”

StrataKit components can be used in one of two ways:

  • Either use the @stratakit/bricks and @stratakit/structures packages directly.
  • Or use the @stratakit/react package, which wraps the above packages in a familiar iTwinUI-shaped API.

All StrataKit components are expected to be used as descendants of the Root component from @stratakit/foundations.
